images.title: Eric Jones / View east along the cliff tops in the direction of Amlwch
images.caption: View east along the cliff tops in the direction of Amlwch. The buildings on the far promontory were part of the now disused works of Octel/Great Lakes Chemicals, the manufacturers of engine "antiknock" products based on bromine extracted from sea water.

description: This beautiful village sits just to the west of Amlwch on the north coast of Anglesey. Bull Bay is notable as the most northerly village in Wales. This circular walk from the village takes you along a section of the Anglesey Coast Path to neighbouring town of Amlwch. It's a splendid section of the coast with fine views from the cliff top paths and some wonderful rock formations to see on the way. From Amlwch you then follow inland roads and footpaths back to the village via Burwen and the golf course. In Amlwch you could stop off to visit the Copper Kingdom visitor centre where you can find out all about the fascinating history of this major copper mining town.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy relaxation and refreshment at the Trecastell Hotel. They are positioned in a great spot with an outdoor seating area providing fine views over the water. You can find them at 28 Trecastell Park with postcode LL68 9SA for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The coastal paths make for a bracing dog walk. The Trecastell Hotel mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Anglesey Walks page.

display_address: Amlwch, Porthllechog, Ynys Môn / Isle of Anglesey, Cymru / Wales, LL68 9SW, United Kingdom
